q: the White House and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan. 28. Oscar

Institute, a left-of-center think tank closely aligned with organized labor. Bill Lockyer , California's state treasurer, participated in a national telephonic news conference with EPI officials, to denounce the bankruptcy concept. No state needs to declare bankruptcy, Bill Lockyer said, "The states have sovereign taxing power the big companies don't." Bill Lockyer 's point- a valid one- is that bankruptcy is the refuge for individuals, corporations and local governments

could do that, I'm good," Anthony Parker said. A healthy Anthony Parker scored 25 points, Allen Iverson had 24 points and 13 assists, and the Denver Nuggets beat the Charlotte Bobcats 117-101 on Saturday night. It didn't hurt at all, said Anthony Parker , who missed five games after landing on the foot of Kobe Bryant on Jan. 21. "It felt good to be back." . Back in October, The Blaze reported that Indiana Republican Congressman Mike Pence was considering stepping down from his post as House Republican Chairman in order to run for president in 2012. Similarly, Politico wrote, Mike Pence , a darling of the conservative movement, would leave the leadership job with a blunt explanation to colleagues that he can't commit to a two-year term in House leadership, a source familiar with his deliberations. Mike Pence was the winner of a presidential straw poll at the Values Voter Summit in Washington, D.C. Mike Pence edged out Mike Huckabee , former Massachusetts governor Mitt Romney , former House Speaker Newt Gingrich , and Sarah Palin .

but not in war, were sent into combat zones under-equipped, ill-trained and in inflated numbers, the report reads. As a result, the "ghost soldiers" often couldn't perform their duties. Generals in the field, unable to obtain sufficient civil affairs units, sent reservists into harm's way without hardened armored vehicles, protective plates for their armored vests and machine guns, the report reads. his play Friday night. Once he got the chance. Coming off the bench for the first time as a Piston, Allen Iverson scored 17 points and led Detroit to a 107-97 victory over the slumping Milwaukee Bucks. With everything going on, I wanted to play well, Allen Iverson said. "I just wanted to play well. Especially for my teammates because I let them down by not being here."
